update.description:
This branch adds support for OpenStack to CloudSim using the AWS compatibility layer. It includes minor fixes for some scripts. ```create_cloudsim.py``` and ```cloudsim_bootstrap``` work again.

The instructions in the Gazebo wiki still apply to this branch, so AWS should be back. If you want to test OpenStack, you can do the following:

```shell
$ vagrant up
$ vagrant ssh

# Now you're inside the Vagrant VM

$ cd devstack
$ . eucarc admin
$ set|grep EC2 # this will print the EC2 credentials, you will have to copy them
$ logout

# Now you're on your machine

$ bin/create_cloudsim.py $EC2_ACCESS_KEY $EC_SECRET_KEY nova
```

The ```nova``` availability zone makes CloudSim use the OpenStack-specific code, but leaving it out will just run against the Amazon servers.

This branch depends on pull request #124, please merge that one before merging this.
update.title: Add support for OpenStack via the AWS layer

content.raw:
It's extremely slow but it works!
I was able to launch CloudSim and another CloudSim instance within it.

Some suggestions:
* Add the email into the create_cloudsim.py command.
* Just for the documentation explain a little the different types and options available for flavors.
* Explain what are the *. eucarc admin* and *. openrc admin* doing.
content.html:
It's extremely slow but it works! I was able to launch CloudSim and another CloudSim instance within it.

Some suggestions: Add the email into the create_cloudsim.py command. Just for the documentation explain a little the different types and options available for flavors. Explain what are the . eucarc admin and . openrc admin* doing.

pull_request.title: Add support for OpenStack via the AWS layer

pullrequest.title: Add support for OpenStack via the AWS layer

content.raw:
I forgot to mention that you'll need to create a new OpenStack flavor (instance type in EC2). The Ubuntu images I'm using require at least 2GB of root disk, but t1.micro only has 1GB and the other flavors have too much memory.

Please follow these steps to create the ```cloudsim-basic``` flavor:

```shell
$ vagrant ssh

# Now you're inside the Vagrant VM

$ cd devstack
$ . openrc admin
$ nova flavor-create cloudsim-basic auto 512 2 1
$ logout

# Now you're back on the host machine
```
content.html:
I forgot to mention that you'll need to create a new OpenStack flavor (instance type in EC2). The Ubuntu images I'm using require at least 2GB of root disk, but t1.micro only has 1GB and the other flavors have too much memory.

Please follow these steps to create the cloudsim-basic flavor:

$ vagrant ssh

# Now you're inside the Vagrant VM

$ cd devstack
$ . openrc admin
$ nova flavor-create cloudsim-basic auto 512 2 1
$ logout

# Now you're back on the host machine

The instructions in the Gazebo wiki still apply to this branch, so AWS should be back. If you want to test OpenStack, you can do the following:

```shell
# Now you're inside the Vagrant VM

$ cd devstack
$ . eucarc admin
$ set|grep EC2 # this will print the EC2 credentials, you will have to copy them
$ logout

# Now you're on your machine

$ bin/create_cloudsim.py $EC2_ACCESS_KEY $EC_SECRET_KEY nova
```

The ```nova``` availability zone makes CloudSim use the OpenStack-specific code, but leaving it out will just run against the Amazon servers.

This branch depends on pull request #124, please merge that one before merging this.
